Belgium: Joyous Entry of 1356: Joanna, Duchess of Brabant and her husband Wenceslaus I of Luxembourg sign the great charter of liberties of the Duchy of Brabant.
Burma: Massive Shan raids into Upper Burma begin (to 1368)
China: Red Turban Rebellion: The rebel army captured Nanjing.
England: Battle of Poitiers: Second of the three major battles of the Hundred Years' War took place near Poitiers, France.
France: Battle of Poitiers a major battle of the Hundred Years' War between England and France.
Germany: The Imperial Diet issued the Golden Bull of 1356, which fixed the offices of the seven prince-electors and established that the Holy Roman Emperor could be elected by a simple majority vote.
Malta: Giacomo Pelegrino is noted as 'Capitano della Verga' ('Hakem').
